Name.label: Male infertility due to large-headed multiflagellar polyploid spermatozoa
Male infertility with teratozoospermia due to single gene mutation

TextSection.Contents: Male infertility due to large-headed multiflagellar polypoid spermatozoa is a male infertility due to sperm disorder characterized by the presence, in sperm, of a very high percentage of spermatozoa with enlarged head, irregular head shape, multiple flagella, and abnormal midpiece and acrosome. It is generally associated with severe oligoasthenozoospermia and a high rate of sperm chromosomal abnormalities (polyploidy, aneuploidy).

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))
